org.tantalum.net
Class StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask

java.lang.Object
  org.tantalum.Task
      org.tantalum.net.StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask
All Implemented Interfaces:
Workable
Enclosing class:
StaticWebCache
public final class StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask
extends Task

This Task performs a StaticWebCache.GET_ANYWHERE operation on a Worker thread in the background. For convenience, you normally call StaticWebCache.get(String url, int priority, int getType, Task task) where getType is StaticWebCache.GET_ANYWHERE and task is some operation you supply which you would like to act on the result of the get(). You can, if you prefer, invoke this class directly to tailor how it operates or set parameters. The pattern for synchronous use when on a background Worker thread is: 


 Object out = new GetAnywhereTask().exec(String url);
The pattern for asynchronous use from the UI thread is: 

 UITask uiTask = new UITask() {
    protected Object doInBackground(final Object in) {
       Object out = in;
       // Do something on the Worker thread with the fetched data
       return out;
    }

    protected void onCanceled() {
        // Do something on the UI thread if the Task is cancel()ed or there is an error (usually HTTP error)
    }

    protected void onPostExecute(Object result) {
       // Do something on the UI Thread with the result from doInBackground() above
    }
 };

 Task getTask = new GetAnywhereTask(String url);
 getTask.chain(uiTask);
 getTask.fork();

Constructor Detail

StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask

public StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask()
Create a StaticWebCache.GET_ANYWHERE actor which will execute on the Worker thread using as input the chain()ed output from a previous Task. For most purposes, it is easier to use the convenience method StaticWebCache.get() to chain your Task after the get operation before fork()ing the Task for background execution.

StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask

public StaticWebCache.GetAnywhereTask(java.lang.String key,
                                      byte[] postMessage)
Create a StaticWebCache.GET_ANYWHERE actor which will execute on the Worker thread. This already knows the URL, so does not need to be chain()ed to another Task to operate properly. For most purposes, it is easier to use the convenience method StaticWebCache.get() to chain your Task after the get operation before fork()ing the Task for background execution.

Parameters:
key -
postMessage -
